oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Letter from William Winchester to James Winchester
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Letter from William Winchester to his son, Lieutenant James Winchester, tells him of the family's hope that he will soon be released from prison, March 18, 1779.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Revolutionaries; Correspondence; Prisoners of war
United States--History--Revolution, 1775-1783
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: While he was serving in the Maryland militia during the Revolutionary War, James Winchester was twice captured and exchanged. He moved to Tennessee [then part of North Carolina] in 1785, and he served as a general during the War of 1812. Winchester commanded troops during the Battle of Frenchtown (1813) in the Northwest Territory. His home, Cragfont, still stands in Sumner County, Tennessee.
